column4: Anyone fo good peoples,  could you be so kind to help? in gnome, i need to find how to change a key binding, guys, how to select multiple items in ubuntu, like ctrl in windows? CTRL moves the window right now...
by default ALT should move the window and CTRL should still select multiple things.
But System>Preferences>Keyboard (Shortcuts) _should_ be able to help you out.
for some reason it's different for me. can you help find it in shortcuts? i just don't see it there...
try going to "Keyboard" (not shortcuts) then to "Layouts" and click "Layout Options"
I think Alt/Win behaviour might be what you are looking for, check to see if it's "Default"?
al/win is default..
what does the "Alt" key currently do for you?
in nautilus it does... nothing that i see
it doesn't select multiple objects or move the window?
alf+f opens file...
just holding Alt, I mean.
- no, holding alt is nothing
I need to find where is file selection binding... any idea?
no idea, sorry. What keyboard layout are you using?
us,ru...
that might be the "problem" then. Your layout might just map the Alt/Ctrl (and maybe others) differently..
okay...
you did it, thanks a lot. ctrl+alt does it - select multiple items_)) so happy now. though would be better to find where to adjust that.
Yeah, I'm not finding where to change that, though I think I might have seen it somewhere before..
have a good day, bye. Thanks for the help.
